response.original_title: Being Texan: A Texas Monthly Special
response.overview: "Texas Monthly" writers explore people and places at the intersections of identity, history, progress, and change. Stories include the ghost town of Terlingua, the last surviving ninepin bowling alleys, a ranching industry under threat, the unexpected discovery of a rare type of coyote, a woman who overturned state braiding laws, and a mild-mannered librarian who fought to save the Big Thicket.
response.title: Being Texan: A Texas Monthly Special
